alert.note: Alert for Clay; Coosa; Talladega; Tallapoosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 29 at 10:43PM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Talladega, northwestern Tallapoosa, northeastern Coosa and southwestern Clay Counties through 1130 PM CST... At 1043 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Stewartville, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Sylacauga, Goodwater, Stewartville, Parkdale, Cleveland Crossroads, Sylacauga Municipal Airport, Overbrook, Gantts Quarry, Hollins, Hackneyville, Roselle, Millerville and Mignon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CST for east central Alabama.
